meta.title: The Unreachability Principle: From Metric Invariants to Operational Selmer Geometry
meta.subtitle: Why Metric Approaches to BSD Must Fail and What Replaces Them
meta.author: Zelenka_D

citations.cite_as: Zelenka, D. (2025). The Unreachability Principle: From Metric Invariants to Operational Selmer Geometry. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.18409219

abstract: We introduce a framework where mathematical objects are treated as operationally unobtainable attractors approached through sequences of finite approximations. For classical constants and algebraic integers, this yields the Unreachability Principle, where attractors are organized by a metric threading depth. Empirical testing validates this principle for Mahler measures (n=2256, perfect Ω_p detection). However, large-scale analysis of elliptic curves (n=15,112) reveals a fundamental breakdown of metric organization: rank and canonical height show negligible correlation with metric invariants (R² ≤ 0.09), falsifying initial scaling predictions. We prove this failure is a structural necessity: rank is a coherence dimension, not a metric invariant. Consequently, we propose Operational Selmer Geometry, where Selmer groups represent coherent operational threads at finite depth. Within this framework, the Birch–Swinnerton-Dyer conjecture is reframed as a stability theorem: analytic instability equals algebraic coherence. This shift positions Selmer theory not as an auxiliary tool, but as the fundamental language of unobtainable arithmetic objects.

central_insight.principle: Mathematical objects such as π, e, or elliptic curve E/ℚ are operationally unreachable: no finite process exhausts their arithmetic content
central_insight.what_we_perceive: Attractor α in metric or categorical space, approached via sequence of finite shadows O^n(x)

for_elliptic_curves.metric_shadows: Reductions modulo primes p, truncated p-adic approximations
for_elliptic_curves.operational_shadows: Finite Galois representations, Selmer groups Sel_{p^k}(E)

central_insight.unreachability_principle: Properties of α are properties of the stability of the approximation process

domain_dichotomy.simple_metric: Algebraic integers: stability governed by distance from attractor
domain_dichotomy.complex_arithmetic: Elliptic curves: stability governed by coherence across inverse system of shadows

three_predictions_tested.prediction_1: Mahler Measure Quantization: Threading depth organizes algebraic integers

three_predictions_tested.prediction_2: Elliptic Height Scaling: Heights scale as ĥ_min ~ |Δ|^{-1/12}

three_predictions_tested.prediction_3: Rank-Threading Correlation: Rank correlates with τ = log log |Δ|

dichotomy_is_explanatory.algebraic_integers: Finite objects with metric structure → threading depth works
dichotomy_is_explanatory.elliptic_curves: Unobtainable objects with coherence structure → threading depth fails

definition.setup: Let O: X → X be operation on metric space (X, d). Attractor α ∈ X is operationally unreachable if:
conditions: lim_{n→∞} O^n(x) = α for all x in basin B ⊆ X
O^n(x) ≠ α for all finite n and x ∈ B
d(O^n(x), α) > 0 for all finite n, but lim_{n→∞} d(O^n(x), α) = 0

threading_depth.interpretation: Measures how many operational layers separate x from α
threading_depth.meaningful_when: d measures approximation quality in metrizable space

domains: Classical attractors: π, e, φ (convergent sequences in ℝ)
Algebraic integers: Mahler measures (multiplicative height in ℝ_{>0})
p-adic approximations: Valuations define natural metrics
Coherence dimensions: Structures requiring consistency across inverse systems
Global arithmetic: Invariants depending on simultaneous local conditions
Derived functors: Cohomological dimensions (rank, Shafarevich-Tate group)
when_fails.empirical_confirmation: Predictions 2-3 falsification demonstrates elliptic curve rank belongs to this category

lehmers_conjecture.statement: M(α) ≥ L_0 > 1 for all non-cyclotomic α
lehmers_conjecture.mahler_measure: M(α) = product of conjugates outside unit circle
lehmers_conjecture.cyclotomic_attractor: Cyclotomic polynomials have M(α) = 1 (all roots on unit circle), so τ = 0

omega_p_hierarchy.definition: Ω_p := inf {M(α) : deg α = p, M(α) > 1}
omega_p_hierarchy.prediction: Threading depths cluster near log Ω_p with forbidden zones between consecutive attractors

findings: All minimal Mahler measures match known Ω_p values to machine precision
Forbidden zones confirmed: no polynomials between Ω_3 and Ω_5 (gap Δτ = 0.085)
1000 random polynomials per degree found the known minima

results_table.degree_3: Ω_p = 1.324718, τ_p = 0.2812, Min Found = 1.324718, Match = Perfect
results_table.degree_5: Ω_p = 1.216392, τ_p = 0.1959, Min Found = 1.216392, Match = Perfect
results_table.degree_7: Ω_p = 1.176281, τ_p = 0.1624, Min Found = 1.176281, Match = Perfect
results_table.degree_11: Ω_p = 1.167295, τ_p = 0.1547, Min Found = 1.167295, Match = Perfect
results_table.degree_13: Ω_p = 1.153076, τ_p = 0.1424, Min Found = 1.153076, Match = Perfect

mahler_validation.conclusion: Threading depth successfully organizes algebraic integers. Metric structure (M: ℤ[α] → ℝ_{>0}) admits meaningful threading depth

initial_predictions.height_scaling: ĥ_min ~ C |Δ|^{-1/12} where Δ is discriminant
initial_predictions.rank_correlation: Rank r correlates with τ = log log |Δ|

dataset.criteria: All curves with conductor N ≤ 100,000 and computed rank

height_prediction_failure.proxy: Regulator reg(E) as height proxy (reg ~ ĥ_min^r)

results.rank_1_conductor: R² = 0.070 (log N explains 7.0% of regulator variance)
results.rank_2_conductor: R² = 0.044 (log N explains 4.4% of regulator variance)

height_prediction_failure.conclusion: Neither discriminant nor conductor threading organizes heights. Predicted |Δ|^{-1/12} scaling does not hold

results.discriminant_threading: τ_Δ = log log |Δ|: ρ = -0.187 (negative!), R² = 0.032 (3.2% variance)
results.conductor_threading: τ_N = log log N: ρ = +0.103 (weak positive), R² = 0.011 (1.1% variance)

rank_prediction_failure.conclusion: Threading depth explains only 1-3% of rank variance. Correlation weak and inconsistent (sign depends on invariant choice)

metric_coherence_dichotomy.metric_invariants: Height, discriminant, conductor measure distance to attractor—how far from unobtainable curve
metric_coherence_dichotomy.rank: Measures coherence dimension—how many independent operational threads persist through all depths

structural_necessity.orthogonality: Distance and coherence are orthogonal concepts. Metric cannot detect whether approximation sequence is globally consistent
structural_necessity.analogy: Knot theory: crossing number (metric complexity) does not determine unknot (topological coherence). Similarly: discriminant (arithmetic complexity) does not determine rank (Selmer coherence)

selmer_groups_reinterpreted.classical: p-Selmer group Sel_p(E) is subgroup of H¹(ℚ, E[p]) satisfying local conditions
selmer_groups_reinterpreted.operational: Sel_p(E) = space of finite-depth operational threads: approximations to E that are locally coherent everywhere at depth p
selmer_groups_reinterpreted.selmer_elements: Not rational points, nor geometric cycles. Coherent operational threads—approximations surviving every local test at fixed finite depth
selmer_groups_reinterpreted.rational_points: Exceptional Selmer elements: threads persisting through ALL depths, surviving entire inverse system {Sel_{p^n}(E)}_{n≥1}

rank_as_coherence_dimension.interpretation: Rank counts independent operational threads persisting through all truncations. Limit-dimensional invariant, invisible to finite-level measurements

invisible_to: Finite-depth approximations (reduction mod p, truncated p-adic)
coherence_invisibility.explains: Why Predictions 2-3 failed: attempted to predict coherence dimension using metric invariants

finite_obstructions_vs_free_rank.sha_and_tamagawa: Absorb bounded inconsistencies—finite obstructions preventing certain Selmer elements from being rational points
finite_obstructions_vs_free_rank.free_rank: Corresponds to unbounded operational capacity: directions along which coherent threads extend indefinitely without collapse

analytic_rank_as_instability.definition: Analytic rank r_an = ord_{s=1} L(E,s) measures dimension of global operational incoherence at attractor
analytic_rank_as_instability.interpretation: Each vanishing derivative at s=1 corresponds to unresolved global constraint. Order-r zero represents r-dimensional space of global instability
analytic_rank_as_instability.finite_data_insufficient: Finite arithmetic data (local heights, Tamagawa, finite Sha) cannot absorb this instability. Only infinite-depth operational threads (rational point generators) can neutralize it

bsd_operational_formulation.precise: Dimension of global operational incoherence (analytic rank) equals dimension of stable Selmer core (algebraic rank)
bsd_operational_formulation.interpretation: Every global analytic defect exactly neutralized by independent infinite-depth arithmetic thread. BSD not equality of unrelated invariants—stability principle asserting coherence between analytic and algebraic approximations to unobtainable object

necessity_of_selmer.theorem: Any invariant that: (i) organizes elliptic curve rank, (ii) is computable, (iii) respects BSD, must encode Selmer tower structure, not metric geometry
necessity_of_selmer.proof_sketch: Rank is coherence dimension (invisible to metric invariants). Empirical testing confirms metric failure. Selmer groups unique computable objects encoding global coherence at finite depth while supporting passage to limit. Any BSD-compatible framework must use Selmer-type structures

dilation_singularity.geometric_analogy: Consider dilation D_k acting on pre-image P. As k → 0, object collapses to point-state. Operation well-defined in limit, but information to 're-dilate' or recover original structure is lost. Cannot multiply zero by infinity to reconstruct specific geometry
dilation_singularity.honey_i_shrunk_the_preimage: Why scalar invariants (discriminant, conductor, height) fail to organize BSD barrier
dilation_singularity.l_function_vanishing: Vanishing of L(E,s) at s=1 (analytic rank) is dilation to zero. Attempting to reconstruct algebraic rank from this analytic zero using metric tools = attempting to recover information from singularity
dilation_singularity.resolution: Shift focus from size of object to coherence of thread. While metric shadow vanishes at critical point, Selmer tower remains well-defined inverse system. BSD barrier not distance to travel, but information loss barrier. Rational points not 're-dilated' analytic zeros, but persistent stable cores of coherence process that never reached zero-state

validated_components: Operational unreachability for classical attractors (π, e, φ)
Threading depth quantization for Mahler measures (algebraic integers)
Process-primacy: operations more fundamental than objects
Unobtainability: mathematical objects as attractors, not accessible entities

changes_from_initial: Threading depth does NOT organize elliptic curves (falsified empirically)
Metric invariants (discriminant, conductor, height) measure distance, not coherence
Rank is coherence dimension, requiring Selmer-theoretic tools
BSD is stability theorem, not metric relationship

prediction_selmer_correlation.statement: p-Selmer rank dim Sel_p(E) correlates more strongly with algebraic rank than any metric invariant (discriminant, conductor, threading depth)

prediction_coherence_complexity.statement: For curves with equal discriminant |Δ| but different ranks, higher-rank curve exhibits larger Selmer groups at all finite depths p^n
prediction_coherence_complexity.tests: Whether Selmer structure, not metric geometry, organizes rank

prediction_stability_scaling.statement: Ratio |Sel_p(E)| / p^{2r} (Selmer size normalized by free rank) exhibits universal scaling independent of discriminant or conductor
prediction_stability_scaling.tests: Universal coherence principles independent of metric data

arithmetic_geometry: Unobtainable objects require coherence-based tools (Selmer, étale cohomology)
Metric approaches to Diophantine equations have structural limitations
BSD is stability/coherence theorem, not metric equality
mathematical_philosophy: Process-primacy extends to coherent approximation processes
Objects are attractors; what exists are operational threads approaching them
Finite measurements cannot capture infinite-depth coherence
computational_number_theory: Rank prediction should use Selmer-based algorithms, not metric heuristics
BSD numerical evidence should focus on Selmer/analytic alignment

scientific_integrity: Testing against large-scale real data (15,112 curves, 2256 polynomials)
Using failures to discover deeper structure (Selmer coherence)
methodological_contribution.key_insight: Failure of metric predictions not defeat—DISCOVERY. Explains why Selmer theory not auxiliary tooling but correct language for understanding unobtainable arithmetic objects

key_equations.operational_unreachability: lim_{n→∞} O^n(x) = α, O^n(x) ≠ α for finite n, d(O^n(x), α) > 0 finite, lim_{n→∞} d(O^n(x), α) = 0
key_equations.mahler_measure: M(α) = product of conjugates outside unit circle
key_equations.omega_p_hierarchy: Ω_p := inf {M(α) : deg α = p, M(α) > 1}
key_equations.rank_threading: τ = log log |Δ| (FALSIFIED correlation with rank)
key_equations.selmer_operational: Sel_p(E) = space of finite-depth operational threads

mahler_measures.conclusion: Threading depth WORKS for algebraic integers

elliptic_curves.conclusion: Threading depth FAILS for elliptic curves
